item.title: Interactive Brokers表示押注美国中期选举应能提振其平台增长
item.description: 随着美国民众对11月中期选举的押注持续升温，Interactive Brokers创始人兼董事长托马斯·彼得菲表示，他预计该公司2024年推出的预测市场平台今年将加速增长。【原文：As Americans bet on U.S. midterm elections in November, Interactive Brokers founder and chairman Thomas Peterffy said he expects growth to accelerate this year for the prediction markets platform his company launched in 2024.】

item.title: Verizon网络在美国数千用户中出现故障，Downdetector数据显示
item.description: 据故障追踪网站Downdetector.com显示，美国威瑞森通信公司（Verizon Communications）的网络于周三在美国境内数千名用户中出现故障。【原文：Verizon Communications' network was down for thousands of users in the U.S. on Wednesday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 加州将就深度伪造内容对xAI展开调查，官员称
item.description: 加州官员表示，他们正要求埃隆·马斯克旗下的xAI公司作出解释。此前该平台上非自愿性影像的传播引发全球关注。【原文：California officials said they were demanding answers from Elon Musk's xAI amid the spread of non-consensual sexual images on the platform that has prompted global scrutiny.】

item.title: 欧盟发言人表示，欧盟将仔细评估X公司承诺对Grok进行的改进。
item.description: 欧盟委员会发言人周三表示，该机构将仔细评估埃隆·马斯克旗下X平台宣布对其Grok聊天机器人所作的调整。【原文：The European Commission will carefully assess changes Elon Musk's platform X has said it would make to its Grok chatbot, a spokesperson said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 甲骨文因人工智能建设相关损失遭债券持有人起诉
item.description: 周三，债券持有人对甲骨文公司提起诉讼，称该公司因未能披露其需要出售大量额外债务来建设人工智能基础设施，导致投资者遭受损失。该公司由亿万富翁拉里·埃里森领导。【原文：Oracle was sued on Wednesday by bondholders who say they suffered losses because the company led by billionaire Larry Ellison failed to disclose it needed to sell significant additional debt to build out its artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: eBay公布首份气候计划，目标2045年实现净零排放
item.description: 电商公司eBay周三公布了首份气候转型计划，宣布将加大运营和供应链脱碳力度，作为实现2045年净零排放目标的重要举措。【原文：E-commerce company eBay unveiled its first climate transition plan on Wednesday and said it would ramp up efforts to decarbonize its operations and supply chain as part of a plan to reach net-zero emissions by 2045.】

item.title: 美联储官员米兰：外国央行对鲍威尔面临起诉威胁的评论不恰当
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会理事斯蒂芬·米兰周三在欧洲听众面前表示，外国央行为美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔辩护的言论不恰当，并驳斥了对美国金融机构韧性的担忧，称其为"博眼球的文章"。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran told a European audience ​on Wednesday that comments from foreign ‌central banks in defense of Fed Chair Jerome Powell were inappropriate, and dismissed concerns about the resilience of U.S. ‌institutions as "people writing things for clicks."】

item.title: 古尔斯比称鲍威尔为"首轮当选的联邦储备委员会主席名人堂成员"，美国国家公共电台报道
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯坦·古尔斯比周三表示，美国央行的独立性对抑制通胀至关重要，而针对央行的攻击——例如特朗普政府对美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔的刑事调查——可能使这项任务更加困难。【原文：The independence of the U.S. central bank is critical to containing inflation, and attacks against it, such as the Trump ​administration's criminal probe into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, threaten to ‌make that task harder, Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西金融科技公司Agibank申请在美国上市
item.description: 巴西金融科技公司Agibank周三向美国监管机构提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：Brazilian fintech Agibank has filed for an initial public offering in the United States, a regulatory filing showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: CrowdStrike击败股东诉讼，涉重大软件故障事件
item.description: 一名联邦法官驳回了CrowdStrike股东提起的诉讼。这些股东指控这家网络安全公司通过隐瞒其不完善的软件测试和质量保证程序欺诈了他们——此前在2024年7月的一次系统故障中，全球超过800万台基于微软Windows的计算机因此瘫痪。【原文：A federal judge dismissed a ​lawsuit by CrowdStrike shareholders who said the cybersecurity company defrauded them by concealing ‌its inadequate software testing and quality assurance procedures, before a July 2024 outage crashed more than 8 million Microsoft Windows-based computers worldwide.】

item.title: 美国企业库存10月再度增加
item.description: 美国企业库存10月在销售下滑的情况下进一步增加，这表明库存可能对第四季度国内生产总值产生贡献。【原文：U.S. business inventories increased further in October as sales dropped, suggesting inventories could contribute to gross domestic ​product in the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 美联储官员米兰表示，特朗普的放松监管政策将有助于降低通胀，为降息提供依据。
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬·米兰周三表示，特朗普政府的放松监管举措将对通胀形成下行压力，这也是美国央行降息的又一理由。【原文：The Trump administration's deregulation effort will put downward pressure on inflation and is another reason for the U.S. central bank ​to cut interest rates, Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said on ‌Wednesday.】

item.title: 法国监管机构突击搜查审计公司，作为反垄断调查的一部分
item.description: 法国竞争监管机构周三表示，已突击搜查多家审计公司，作为反垄断调查的一部分。金融刊物《La Lettre》称，德勤、毕马威、安永和普华永道等"四大"审计公司均在被调查之列。【原文：France's competition watchdog has raided auditing firms as part of an anti-trust investigation, it said on Wednesday, while La Lettre financial publication said the "Big Four" firms Deloitte, KPMG, EY and PWC were among those targeted.】

item.title: 美国12月成屋销售加速增长
item.description: 美国12月成屋销售加速增长，得益于抵押贷款利率下降和房价涨幅放缓。【原文：U.S. existing home sales accelerated in December, boosted by lower mortgage rates and slow growth in house prices.】

item.title: 美联储保尔森重申，在通胀趋缓后可能进一步降息
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行行长安娜·保尔森周三重申，若经济符合其通胀放缓、就业市场趋稳的预期，央行可能在今年晚些时候下调短期利率。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Anna Paulson reiterated Wednesday her expectation that the central bank could lower short-term interest rates later this year if ​the economy meets her expectations of moderating inflation and job market stabilization.】

item.title: 阿联酋加入人工智能供应链计划，加强与美国经济联系
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国周三加入了由美国主导的旨在保障人工智能和半导体供应链安全的倡议——"硅基和平"，此举进一步巩固了该国与美国的经济纽带。【原文：The United Arab Emirates on Wednesday joined a U.S.-led initiative to secure AI and semiconductor supply chains, dubbed Pax Silica, further strengthening economic ties with the United States.】

item.title: 美国第三季度经常账户赤字大幅收窄
item.description: 美国经常账户赤字大幅收窄，因关税抑制了进口，同时初级收入激增。【原文：The U.S. current account deficit narrowed sharply as tariffs weighed on imports and primary ​income surged.】

item.title: 马斯克表示他并不知晓Grok生成未成年人的露骨图像
item.description: 埃隆·马斯克周三表示，他并不知晓xAI旗下Grok聊天机器人生成任何"未成年人裸体图像"，而全球对该人工智能工具的审查力度正在不断加强。【原文：Elon Musk said on Wednesday he was not aware of any "naked underage images" generated by xAI's Grok chatbot, as scrutiny of the AI tool intensifies worldwide.】

item.title: 美国11月生产者价格温和上涨
item.description: 11月美国生产者价格指数小幅回升，主要受汽油成本激增推动，但企业似乎正在吸收部分进口关税影响，贸易利润率因此受到挤压。【原文：U.S. producer prices picked up slightly in November amid a surge in the cost of gasoline, but businesses appeared to be absorbing some of the ​tariffs on imports, with trade margins compressing.】

item.title: 独家：巴西亿万富翁巴蒂斯塔会晤委内瑞拉罗德里格斯及美国官员
item.description: 巴西亿万富翁若埃斯利·巴蒂斯塔周五会见了委内瑞拉临时总统德尔西·罗德里格斯，并在会前会后与美国官员进行了接触。一位知情人士告诉路透社，巴蒂斯塔向美方保证，罗德里格斯似乎准备向投资开放该国的石油和天然气行业。【原文：Brazilian billionaire Joesley Batista met with Venezuela's interim President Delcy Rodriguez on Friday and met with U.S. officials before and after, reassuring them that she seems ready to open her nation's oil and gas industry to investment, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国银行业巨头借贷需求增长而获利更多
item.description: 美国大型银行第四季度利润大幅增长，这得益于借款人需求的增加，该趋势可能预示着贷款机构未来盈利前景向好。【原文：U.S. banking giants boosted their profits in the fourth quarter, buoyed by increasing demand from borrowers that could bode well for lenders' future earnings.】

item.title: 美国11月零售销售超出预期
item.description: 美国11月零售额增幅超预期，汽车购买量回升且家庭在其他领域的支出增加，表明第四季度经济增长势头强劲。【原文：U.S. retail sales increased more than expected in November as motor vehicle purchases rebounded and households increased spending elsewhere, pointing to solid economic growth in the fourth ​quarter.】

item.title: 萨克斯全球申请破产保护揭示其资产、债权人及融资状况
item.description: 高端百货集团萨克斯全球公司于周二深夜申请破产保护，距离其旨在打造奢侈品巨头的交易达成仅过去不到一年。【原文：High-end department store conglomerate Saks Global filed for bankruptcy protection late on Tuesday, barely a year after a deal that aimed to create a luxury powerhouse.】

item.title: 香奈儿、开云领衔萨克斯全球无担保债权人奢侈品大咖榜单
item.description: 法庭文件显示，法国奢侈品牌香奈儿和古驰母公司开云集团位列破产美国百货公司萨克斯全球公司无担保债权人榜首，其债权金额分别为1.36亿美元和6000万美元。【原文：French luxury brand Chanel and Gucci owner Kering top the list of unsecured creditors of bankrupt U.S. department store Saks Global, with ​claims of $136 million and $60 million respectively, court documents show.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡里称特朗普政府威胁"关乎货币政策"，《纽约时报》报道
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔·卡什卡利表示，特朗普政府过去一年针对美联储的行动"实质上是关于货币政策的"，他同时为美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔进行了辩护。【原文：Minneapolis Federal Reserve ​President Neel Kashkari ‌said the Trump administration's actions against ‌the central bank ​in the past year ‍were "really about monetary policy," as he ⁠came ‍to the defense of ‌Fed ‌chair Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 欧盟议会考虑因特朗普威胁格陵兰问题冻结美欧贸易协议
item.description: 欧洲议会正考虑暂停欧盟与美国达成的贸易协定实施进程，以抗议美国总统唐纳德·特朗普威胁要夺取格陵兰岛的行为。【原文：The European Parliament is considering putting on hold the European Union's implementation of the trade deal struck with the United States in protest over threats by U.S. President Donald Trump to seize Greenland.】

item.title: 花旗集团利润受俄罗斯业务拖累，并购与服务业务表现亮眼
item.description: 花旗集团第四季度利润下滑13%，因其俄罗斯业务出售相关亏损达12亿美元，抵消了来自交易业务及企业客户服务收入的增长。【原文：Citigroup's profit fell 13% in the fourth quarter as it booked a $1.2 billion loss tied to the sale of its Russia business, offsetting higher revenue from dealmaking and services to corporate clients.】

item.title: 美国生物技术行业有望在2026年实现反弹，因首次公开募股兴趣重燃
item.description: 投资者正密切关注美国生物技术行业在2026年的复苏前景。尽管业界正逐步适应当前的政治与监管环境，但随着并购活动热度回升及利率走低，预计将有更多企业选择上市。【原文：Investors are eyeing a rebound in the U.S. biotech sector in 2026, as more companies ​are expected to go public amid a renewed deal-making appetite and a lower interest rate scenario, even as they come to terms ‌with the political and regulatory environment.】

item.title: 瑞士通过与美国贸易协定的谈判授权
item.description: 瑞士联邦政府周三宣布，联邦委员会已通过与美国就具有法律约束力的贸易协定进行谈判的最终授权。【原文：Switzerland's Federal Council has adopted a final negotiating mandate for talks on a legally binding trade agreement with the United States, the government said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英国首相斯塔默表示，X平台正采取行动以符合英国关于人工智能深度伪造技术的法律规定。
item.description: 英国首相基尔·斯塔默周三表示，在英国媒体监管机构因Grok人工智能聊天机器人制作的性化图像对该平台展开调查后，埃隆·马斯克旗下的X平台正采取行动确保完全遵守英国法律。【原文：British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Wednesday that Elon Musk's X is acting to ensure full compliance with UK law after the country's media regulator launched a probe into the platform over sexualised imagery produced by the Grok AI chatbot.】
